result.execSummary:
The defendant Praveen Kharb #00637685 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Register on sex offender registry and comply with all rules. 

DNA sample.  

Comply with all programs by Department of Corrections.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:34am
State appears by Deputy DA Theresa Wetzsteon; Defendant appears by telephone from WSPS, his attorney Daniel Goggin II appears by telephone.
Date and time set for court's oral ruling

COURT makes findings
COURT RULING: Defendant has asserted the right to appeal separate and distinct from constitutional rights connected to trial; deft has made a sufficient showing that there may have NOT been an adequate record made as to deft knowingly waived a separate and distinct right to appeal. Matter will be reviewed by higher courts and allow second stage of hearing to occur on limited issue. Burden is now shifted to state to show clear and convincing evidence that deft plea was knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently entered despite inadequancy of the record at time of plea. 

Atty Goggin will file another extension for appeal due to extension expiring 12/30/16
COURT will set aside another half day hearing for further matters

COURT did meet with Attorneys twice to discuss scheduling, however all Attorneys do wish to proceed today and not reschedule matter

COURT receives exhibit 4

COURT asks both parties if they wish to proceed today or reschedule for tomorrow to finish sentencing

COURT advised JA to clear afternoon calendar to proceed with sentencing today

OTR: 1:36pm BOTR: 1:37pm

Atty Martin continues argument with addressing medical report
Defendant gives statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1: 30 years WSPS, 15 years IC, 15 years ES, concurrent to Ct. 3-7. Ct. 3 - 7: Imposing on each count 6 years WSPS, 3 years IC, 3 years ES serving consecutive to one another and concurrent to Ct. 1, 8, 9. Ct. 8 & 9: 6 years WSPS, 3 years IC, 3 years ES concurrent to Ct. 1 & Ct. 3 
CONDITIONS: No contact with victim or family. No contact with anyone age 18 or younger. Register on sex offender registry and comply with all rules. No access to computer or wi-fi capabilities unless approved by agent. Maintain or obtain full time work/schooling/combination of two. Comply with all programs by DOC. Pay CC and other fees. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay $500 surcharge for each image possessed. No restitution by victim. Credit of 559 days given to by applied to Ct. 1, 3, 8, 9. Deft not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
